page.title: 17SWIMMING IN MELKSHAM
page.content: Years ago before they had a pool, everyone learned to swim in a tyre tied to a long rope. Jacko Webb taught them in the River Avon down at the Halfpenny Bridge by the Avon Rubber Company. They used to hold swimming galas with all the pretty lights, flags and decorations. This was before they altered the run of the river. It is called Halfpenny Bridge because fyou had to pay a toll of one half pence. Today people swim at the Blue Pool, which is an open air pool. The pool is open from the first of June until the first of September. It has 3 diving boards at different levels. There is a paddling pool for young children. There is talk of building a fun pool with slides, islands and jets of water.
